snippet.textDisplay: It was definitely the best experience for me to play the Triology in Hypermode (hardest difficulty). MP2:Echoes seems much harder at first but in the end the final boss fight was manageable, unlike in MP3, which gave me nightmares and after countless tries I was still not able to kill that thing (there will be revenge!)

snippet.textDisplay: DissociativeIdentity the trilogy loses much of its magic when you take the music away. I played a "realistic" playthrough with it all off, and I was very........bored. What makes this trilogy amazing is literally everything. You take one aspect away, and, you're left with a shell.
snippet.textOriginal: DissociativeIdentity the trilogy loses much of its magic when you take the music away. I played a "realistic" playthrough with it all off, and I was very........bored. What makes this trilogy amazing is literally everything. You take one aspect away, and, you're left with a shell.

snippet.textDisplay: People always get so scared because the light/dark beams have ammo.  They are very destructive weapons and the fact that you are hesitant to use them is a good indicator as to why you are struggling.
snippet.textOriginal: People always get so scared because the light/dark beams have ammo.  They are very destructive weapons and the fact that you are hesitant to use them is a good indicator as to why you are struggling.

snippet.textDisplay: I see a lot of comments talking about the beam ammo system in this game. Not trying to sound arrogant, but I never had a problem keeping my ammo reserves at a comfortable level. I will say, though, I was a pack rat when it came to ammo the first time I played. I enjoyed the game infinitely more when I stopped being a pack rat and just used my light and dark beams as I needed them.
snippet.textOriginal: I see a lot of comments talking about the beam ammo system in this game. Not trying to sound arrogant, but I never had a problem keeping my ammo reserves at a comfortable level. I will say, though, I was a pack rat when it came to ammo the first time I played. I enjoyed the game infinitely more when I stopped being a pack rat and just used my light and dark beams as I needed them.

snippet.textDisplay: I played Prime 2 before either of the others, which is probably I think of it more positively than most people do.  I enjoyed the challenge and I thought the dark world was a nice spin on things
snippet.textOriginal: I played Prime 2 before either of the others, which is probably I think of it more positively than most people do.  I enjoyed the challenge and I thought the dark world was a nice spin on things

snippet.textDisplay:
I had the same problem, after playing prime 1, this one seemed out of place with its ammo system. However biting through it with the support of a friend who is a major fan of the series, I found that the game is amazing in so many ways. He actualy convinced me to play the classics when i finished the trilogy.
Long story short, I have played every single Metroid game I could find...

snippet.textDisplay: I blasted through this game really quickly in 2005. I can barely remember the music but I loved getting the spin jump finally. I remember struggling with some of the bosses and fetching different artifacts was not as fun as the first one. Still a great game. I got the trilogy for a friend and they never played it. I think I'll ask to borrow it.

snippet.textDisplay: I'd say that Metroid 2 and Echoes would be tied for that.  I honestly don't get why people are in love with corruption, but that's just me.  It was so much more linear compared to 1 and 2, and and felt more robotic in atmosphere and the ending was lame.

snippet.textDisplay: ...I never realized how fond my memories of playing this series are until just now, when I looked at this screen of behind-the-visor Samus just standing and looking at the dark beauty before her--something so common in these games. And me sitting here without my Wii. Oh, my God, I love Metroid Prime...
snippet.textOriginal: ...I never realized how fond my memories of playing this series are until just now, when I looked at this screen of behind-the-visor Samus just standing and looking at the dark beauty before her--something so common in these games. And me sitting here without my Wii. Oh, my God, I love Metroid Prime...

@Exarian it feels like evry drop of rain is making each and evry echo noise, almost like at the start the cloud is forming, then it lets out. each time a raindrop hits the ground, or your window, it creates a noise. then the combined noises seem so..... magical...
almost like a rain sleep spell when you think about it.

snippet.textDisplay: @Masz52 I try to 100% everything, not to mention I count the moments I spend taking in the scenery,. I found this one harder though, and my scenic routes would take twice as long due to the forementioned problems with the game. snippet.textDisplay:
It's funny. I don't like Prime 2 that much when I compare it to Prime and Prime 3, but it's still got this place in gaming history for me. It was the game I never finished for a long while, because I thought it was too hard. Then I came back at it later and learned to stop being such a stick in the mud with my light and dark beams, and the game just opened up.

This song is probably an explanation as to how the game makes me feel. Ominous, yet relaxing. It reassures you, even when you're afraid.
snippet.textOriginal:
It's funny. I don't like Prime 2 that much when I compare it to Prime and Prime 3, but it's still got this place in gaming history for me. It was the game I never finished for a long while, because I thought it was too hard. Then I came back at it later and learned to stop being such a stick in the mud with my light and dark beams, and the game just opened up.

This song is probably an explanation as to how the game makes me feel. Ominous, yet relaxing. It reassures you, even when you're afraid.

snippet.textDisplay: I find this funny. I love the music but as this is very much ambient music, it can trace its lineage all the way back to composer Erik Satie in the nineteenth century. sure it's much more electronic and modern, but the ambient music school of composition can easily be traced back to him.
snippet.textOriginal: I find this funny. I love the music but as this is very much ambient music, it can trace its lineage all the way back to composer Erik Satie in the nineteenth century. sure it's much more electronic and modern, but the ambient music school of composition can easily be traced back to him.

snippet.textDisplay:
This game is pretty good. But to be honest, I enjoyed the first one a lot more. For one, I never beat this game. I got stuck on the Dark World boss that is basically a ball and you have to fight it as a morph ball (soooo hard!). But yeah, the first one is superior in environment/ambiance and music.

I have yet to play the 3rd one, but I really would like to someday.

snippet.textDisplay:
The game as a whole wasn't great, it detracted way too far from the original, but it did have some great songs like the first one did. This one definitely being the best song in the game, if only they replaced the dark world with more light world areas... imagine how the game could be twice as big.

All that being said, this game is annoying at best. Metroid Prime 1 was a masterpiece, Metroid Prime 2 was annoying and frustrating, and Metroid Prime 3 was good but way too easy and short.
snippet.textOriginal:
The game as a whole wasn't great, it detracted way too far from the original, but it did have some great songs like the first one did. This one definitely being the best song in the game, if only they replaced the dark world with more light world areas... imagine how the game could be twice as big.

All that being said, this game is annoying at best. Metroid Prime 1 was a masterpiece, Metroid Prime 2 was annoying and frustrating, and Metroid Prime 3 was good but way too easy and short.

snippet.textDisplay: Probably my favorite place in the game with the Sanctuary. Coupled with this ambient track, the area was very atmospheric. I should replay this game someday, it feels like I went through it too quickly. It had some pretty awesome boss fights, but I remember not being a fan of the dark/light world gameplay, at least until you get a certain suit.
